docs.title: Installation

pip install stockcharts

git clone https://github.com/paulboys/HeikinAshi.git
cd HeikinAshi
pip install -e .

docs.text:

stockcharts-rsi-divergence --type bullish --min-price 10
stockcharts-plot-divergence --ticker NVDA --period 6mo

docs.title: Key Concepts
docs.text:
• Heiken Ashi: Smoothed candle representation for trend clarity.
  • RSI Divergence: Price vs RSI swing mismatch signaling potential reversals.
  • Precomputed Indices: Guarantee chart markers align with detected divergences.
  • Tolerance: RSI difference threshold (0.5) to prevent noise.

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text: StockCharts is a Python library and CLI toolkit for screening and visualizing technical setups (Heiken Ashi trends, RSI price divergences) across NASDAQ equities using reproducible programmatic workflows.

docs.title: Core Capabilities
docs.text:
• Heiken Ashi candle color screener (bullish/bearish trend snapshot)
  • RSI price divergence screener (potential reversal detection)
  • Chart generation (price + RSI with divergence markers, Heiken Ashi visualization)
  • Batch data retrieval via yfinance
  • Filtering by price, volume, divergence type, candle color
  • Precomputed indices to guarantee chart-plot alignment

docs.title: High-Level Architecture
docs.text:
stockcharts/
  data/         # Data acquisition (yfinance wrappers)
  indicators/   # Indicator + divergence logic (RSI, divergence detection)
  screener/     # Screeners (Heiken Ashi, RSI divergence)
  charts/       # Plotting utilities (price/RSI, Heiken Ashi)
  cli.py        # Unified CLI entry points

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
pip install -e .

(or add to requirements and pip install -r requirements.txt)

docs.title: CLI Commands
docs.text:
• stockcharts-screen (Heiken Ashi color screener)
  • stockcharts-rsi-divergence (RSI divergence screener)
  • stockcharts-plot (generic price/indicator plot)
  • stockcharts-plot-divergence (price + RSI divergence visualization)

See docs/screener.md and docs/rsi_divergence.md for detailed usage.

docs.title: Quick Reference
docs.text:
Common tasks:

stockcharts-screen --color green --interval 1d
stockcharts-rsi-divergence --type bullish --min-price 10 --period 6mo
stockcharts-plot-divergence --ticker AAPL --period 6mo --interval 1d

More shortcuts in docs/quick_reference.md.

docs.title: Distribution & Packaging Notes
docs.text:
• Project uses pyproject.toml (PEP 621) for build metadata.
  • Entry points expose CLI commands.
  • Versioning follows semantic increments (feature additions: minor; fixes: patch).
  • Internal modules avoid heavy dependencies (core: pandas, numpy, matplotlib, yfinance).

docs.title: Design Principles
docs.text:
• Deterministic screening (consistent output for same parameters/time)
  • Readable, dataclass-based result objects
  • Minimal, explicit parameters (price, volume, lookback, period)
  • Separation of concerns (fetch vs analyze vs visualize)

docs.title: Roadmap Snapshot
docs.text: See docs/roadmap.md for detailed upcoming enhancements.

docs.title: When to Use This Library
docs.text: Use StockCharts when you need fast, scriptable screening plus immediate chart validation—especially for workflow automation or nightly scans.

docs.title: Price Filters
docs.text:
• --min-price / --max-price narrow universe to viable capital ranges.
  • Avoid illiquid penny stocks with --min-price 5 or 10.

docs.title: Volume Filter (RSI Divergence)
docs.text:
• --min-volume N ensures recent average volume (last bar) exceeds threshold.
  • Helps eliminate thinly traded noise setups.

docs.title: RSI Settings
docs.text:
• --rsi-period (default 14). Lower values (9) increase sensitivity; higher (21) smooth.
  • Consider longer period for weekly scans.

docs.title: Swing Window
docs.text:
• --swing-window controls local extremum detection width.
  • Larger window = fewer, more significant swing points.

docs.title: Lookback
docs.text:
• --lookback bars to search for last two qualifying swings.
  • Typical range: 50–80 for daily; can expand for weekly.

docs.title: Data Period
docs.text: • --period sets fetch span (3mo, 6mo, 1y). Must cover at least lookback + buffer.

docs.title: Interval
docs.text: • --interval (1d/1wk/1mo). Screener supports all, but divergence reliability best on daily/weekly.

docs.title: Tolerance
docs.text:
• Fixed RSI tolerance (0.5) ensures meaningful divergence.
  • Adjustable in divergence.py if needed.

docs.title: Input Filter
docs.text:
• --input-filter FILE loads tickers from a previous screener CSV to intersect signals.
  • Enables multi-factor workflows (e.g., green HA AND bullish divergence).

docs.title: Output
docs.text:
• --output FILE writes results to CSV.
  • For reproducibility, include parameters in filename (e.g., div_bullish_6mo_tol0.5.csv).

docs.title: Delay (HA Screener)
docs.text:
• --delay controls per-ticker pause for yfinance.
  • Reduce cautiously (risk rate limiting).

docs.title: Quiet Mode
docs.text: • --quiet suppresses progress logging for cleaner automation output.

docs.title: Recommended Combos
docs.text:
• Momentum exhaustion: --type bearish --min-price 50 --min-volume 2_000_000
  • Reversal scan: --type bullish --swing-window 7 --rsi-period 21
  • Liquidity focus: --min-volume 5_000_000 --min-price 10

docs.title: Concept Recap
docs.text: Divergence highlights momentum disagreement between price action and RSI, hinting at potential reversal or weakening trend. - Bullish: Price lower low, RSI higher low. - Bearish: Price higher high, RSI lower high.

docs.title: Workflow
docs.text:
1. Fetch OHLC data.
  2. Compute RSI (default period=14, EWM-based).
  3. Identify swing highs/lows (window default=5).
  4. Compare last two valid price + RSI swing pairs.
  5. Apply tolerance to avoid noise (>=0.5 RSI point difference required).
  6. Output structured results + optional CSV.

docs.title: Command-Line Usage
docs.text:
stockcharts-rsi-divergence                  # all signals
stockcharts-rsi-divergence --type bullish   # only bullish
stockcharts-rsi-divergence --type bearish   # only bearish
stockcharts-rsi-divergence --min-price 10 --max-price 100
stockcharts-rsi-divergence --rsi-period 21 --lookback 90 --period 6mo
stockcharts-rsi-divergence --min-volume 2_000_000

Key options:

--type {bullish,bearish,all}
--min-price N --max-price N
--min-volume N
--rsi-period N
--swing-window N
--lookback N  (bars for divergence search)
--period {3mo,6mo,1y}  (data fetch span)
--output FILE
--input-filter FILE (restrict tickers to prior screener results)

docs.title: Result Object (CSV Columns)
docs.text:
• Ticker, Company, Price, RSI, Divergence Type
  • Bullish, Bearish (booleans)
  • Details (string describing swing comparison)
  • Precomputed indices for chart overlay

docs.title: Tolerance Logic
docs.text:
BEARISH_RSI_TOLERANCE = 0.5
BULLISH_RSI_TOLERANCE = 0.5
# Bearish: RSI2 + tol < RSI1
# Bullish: RSI2 - tol > RSI1

Prevents false positives (e.g., PLTR slight higher RSI not flagged bearish).

docs.title: Programmatic Use
docs.text:
from stockcharts.screener.rsi_divergence import screen_rsi_divergence
results = screen_rsi_divergence(divergence_type='bullish', min_price=10.0, period='6mo')
for r in results:
    print(r.ticker, r.divergence_type, r.rsi, r.details)

docs.title: Plotting
docs.text:
stockcharts-plot-divergence --ticker NVDA --period 6mo --interval 1d

Overlays price + RSI + detected divergence markers (using precomputed indices if provided).

  • RSI tolerance to remove marginal noise.

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text: Identify immediate bullish (green) or bearish (red) Heiken Ashi candle conditions across a curated NASDAQ list.

docs.title: Core Concept
docs.text: A Heiken Ashi candle is green when HA_Close >= HA_Open and red otherwise. Latest candle color offers a bias snapshot.

docs.title: Command-Line Usage
docs.text:
stockcharts-screen --color green --interval 1d
stockcharts-screen --color red --interval 1wk
stockcharts-screen --color all --interval 1d --output results/all.csv
stockcharts-screen --color green --interval 1d --limit 20 --delay 0.2

Options:

--color {green,red,all}
--interval {1d,1wk,1mo}
--limit N
--delay SECONDS
--output FILE
--quiet

docs.title: Programmatic Usage
docs.text:
from stockcharts.screener import screen_nasdaq
results = screen_nasdaq(color_filter="green", interval="1d", delay=0.5)
for r in results:
    print(r.ticker, r.color, r.ha_close)

Dataclass:

@dataclass
class ScreenResult:
    ticker: str
    color: Literal['green','red']
    ha_open: float
    ha_close: float
    last_date: str
    interval: str

docs.title: Ticker Universe
docs.text: Located in src/stockcharts/screener/nasdaq.py (90+ high-liquidity NASDAQ names). Extend by editing the list.

docs.title: Performance
docs.text:
• ~1–2 minutes for full list with default 0.5s delay.
  • Reduce delay at risk of API throttling.
  • Use --limit for development/testing.

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text:
1. Download OHLC data via yfinance.
  2. Compute Heiken Ashi candles.
  3. Determine last candle color.
  4. Filter & aggregate results.
  5. Optionally output CSV.

docs.title: Integration Points
docs.text:
• Shares data retrieval logic with RSI divergence screener.
  • Charts can visualize individual tickers with HA candles (using charts/heiken_ashi.py).

docs.title: Example Output
docs.text:
Ticker  Color  HA_Open  HA_Close  Last Date   Interval
AVGO    green  338.72   353.09    2025-10-13  1d
AAPL    red    253.25   248.07    2025-10-13  1d

docs.title: Trading Style Guidance
docs.text:
• Bullish daily green: potential continuation.
  • Weekly red emerging: possible broader weakness.
  • Combine with RSI divergence for confirmation.

See docs/trading_styles.md for deeper strategy notes.

docs.title: Swing Trading
docs.text:
Focus on daily bullish divergences confirmed by green HA candles. Parameters:

stockcharts-screen --color green --interval 1d --output results/ha_green.csv
stockcharts-rsi-divergence --type bullish --input-filter results/ha_green.csv --min-price 10 --period 6mo

Combine with volume filter for higher quality: --min-volume 2_000_000.

docs.title: Trend Continuation
docs.text: Weekly green HA + absence of bearish divergence can indicate sustained momentum. Monitor RSI staying above 50.

docs.title: Exhaustion / Reversal Short
docs.text:
Bearish divergence + red HA candle on daily/weekly near prior resistance:

stockcharts-rsi-divergence --type bearish --min-price 50 --min-volume 2_000_000

docs.title: High Liquidity Focus
docs.text:
Use both price and volume constraints:

--min-price 20 --min-volume 5_000_000

Filters out thin and erratic names.

docs.title: Conservative Filtering
docs.text: Increase swing window (7) and RSI period (21) for smoother signals.

docs.title: Aggressive Scouting
docs.text: Lower RSI period (9) and swing window (3) for early/premature signals (expect more noise). Use for watchlist generation.

docs.title: Multi-Factor Intersection
docs.text: Workflow: 1. Run HA screener (green). 2. Feed tickers into divergence screener (--input-filter). 3. Plot top setups for manual validation.

docs.title: Manual Validation Checklist
docs.text:
• Divergence distance (RSI difference > 0.5 confirmed)
  • Price context (support/resistance proximity)
  • Volume trend (expansion on reversal attempt?)
  • Broader market alignment (index direction)

docs.title: Risk Management Notes
docs.text:
• Divergence ≠ guaranteed reversal.
  • Use stop below swing low (bullish) / above swing high (bearish).
  • Position size adjusts for volatility (ATR or percentage basis).

docs.title: Motivation
docs.text: Divergence signals on illiquid tickers are prone to false triggers due to erratic prints. Volume filtering restricts results to symbols with sufficient trading interest.

docs.title: Parameter
docs.text:
--min-volume N

Applied to the most recent bar's volume (or optionally average in future enhancement).

docs.title: Usage Examples
docs.text:
stockcharts-rsi-divergence --min-volume 2_000_000
stockcharts-rsi-divergence --type bullish --min-volume 5_000_000 --min-price 10

docs.title: Impact
docs.text:
• Reduces total divergence count.
  • Increases average reliability of remaining setups.
  • Helps align with institutional-grade liquidity.

docs.title: Suggested Thresholds
docs.text:
• 1,000,000: Light filter
  • 2,000,000: Moderate baseline
  • 5,000,000: High liquidity focus
